data.title: Typo in info message
data.body:
Testing #19057

- run a watch task in the terminal
- invoke the 'Tasks: Terminate Running Task' command

Message dialog says:
The tasks are executed in the intergrated terminal. Use the terminal to manage the tasks.
-> should be **integrated**

Found while testing: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19079 - VSCode Version: 1.9.0 4265f5e3 - OS Version: Mac Sierra Steps to Reproduce: 1. Inside an html file, enter the following emmet expression: ul>.class then press tab 2. Expect: ```
``` Actual: ```
```

data.title: Wording in tasks warning message
data.body:
While testing #19044:

"active running" sounds redundant (or more complex than necessary):
![2017-01-24_18-13-02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/22258159/d26f1e38-e260-11e6-9a44-305937ede102.png)

Why not one of these?
"There is already a task running."
"There is already a running task."
"There is already a task active."
"There is already an active task."

In addition pls consider to simplify the "Terminate Running Task" message in that warning notification to "Terminate" or "Terminate Task".

data.title: Emmet Expansion looses against completion proposals
data.body:
Test item #19079

- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.9.0-insider (4265f5e35cb3ea8ba7e0cf6b14ec606b6f8647ea, 2017-01-24T10:29:13.076Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|autofilename|JerryHong|0.1.3|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install AutoFileName extension
2. Open empty html file
3. Type: html`<tab>`
4. Unexpected: the completion proposals from AutoFileName win against the Emmet Expansion command

Not sure if this is specific to how this extension sets up it completion items, but maybe we can improve that on our side.

data.title: Integrated Shell does not match Shortcut keys in linux terminal-emulator
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: `Version 1.8.1`
- OS Version: `Linux MBP 4.8.0-34-generic #36-Ubuntu SMP Wed Dec 21 17:24:18 UTC 2016 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux`

Steps to Reproduce:

1. do `echo test@test` in ubuntu/gnome terminal emulator
2. doubleclick to select whole string
3. do `echo test@test` in vscode integrated shell
4. doubeclick only selects partial string, `@` character breaks selection

1. CTRL+K and CTRL+U works as expected in ubuntu/gnome terminal emulator
2. CTRL+K and CTRL+U has odd behaviour in vscode integrated shell

data.title: Reindent command should not modify HEREDOC

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #19091

- have a ruby file:
```ruby
expected_result = <<HEREDOC
This would contain specially formatted text.
  This indent is important

That might span many lines
HEREDOC
```
- invoke 'Reindent lines'
- the indent inside the here doc is removed

Feature Request

Would be great if you can add pin tabs feature.

data.title: Multiline searches in CRLF files are weird
data.body:
Have a CRLF file:
```
asdfg
asdfg
```

| Offset | char before | char after | Position
|---|---|---|---|
| 0 | -- | a | (1,1)
| 1 | a | s | (1,2)
| 2 | s | d | (1,3)
| 3 | d | f | (1,4)
| 4 | f | g | (1,5)
| 5 | g | \r | (1,6)
| 6 | \r | \n | --
| 7 | \n | a | (2,1)
| 8 | a | s | (2,2)
| 9 | s | d | (2,3)
| 10 | d | f | (2,4)
| 11 | f | g | (2,5)
| 12 | g | -- | (2,6)

All the searches return correct (offset,len) ranges, but when these ranges are transformed to (ln,col) based ranges, some information loss occurs:

| Regex search | (offset,len) range match | (ln,col) range match | obs
|---|---|---|---|
| \r | (5,1) | (1,6)->(1,6) | offset 6 would land in the middle of the EOL, it is moved to before the EOL |
| \n | (6,1) | (1,6)->(2,1) | offset 6 would land in the middle of the EOL, it is moved to before the EOL |
| \r\n | (5,2) | (1,6)->(2,1) | |

Observe how the conversion from (offset,len) ranges to (ln,col) ranges is skewing the find matches, making it appear that `\n` matches `\r\n`. This is causing grief and confusion all around.

data.title: Config edit service: Remove the setting when it has the default value

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #18316

Toggle wordwrap is false by default.

1) enable Toggle wordwrap -> the setting is inserted into the file with the value: true
2) toggle wordwrap again, the setting is back to the default value.

Since the user didn't insert the setting I would have expected that the setting is removed again so that the settings stay as clean as possible.

data.title: Language specific settings overwrite all or nothing from User to Workspace
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

Test: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19060

- VSCode Version: 1.9
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

User settings:

```
	"[markdown]": {
		"editor.wordWrap": true,
		"editor.lineNumbers": "off"
	}
```

Workspace settings:
```
	"[markdown]": {
	}

```

Displays mardown files with wordwarp false and lineNumbers on

data.title: Annoying behavior while opening files with some settings behind
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:49:23.350Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|jsrefactor|cmstead|0.5.3|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.2|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.1.5|
|vscode-babel-coloring|dzannotti|0.0.4|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.3.4|
|docthis|joelday|0.3.9|
|es6-angular-snips|kasperkeso|0.0.3|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.6.2|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.4.2|
|startanyshell|remcoros|0.3.1|
|gitblame|waderyan|1.3.0|
|JavaScriptSnippets|xabikos|1.2.0|

---

It started when I added following items to my user settings:
    "editor.formatOnType": true,
    "editor.formatOnSave": true

Now whenever I open any file, it's marked as edited - this is very annoying because I can't simply close it - I have to confirm because of *imaginary* (the file didn't changed really) changes that I've done fo this file. 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Add to your user settings following items:
    "editor.formatOnType": true,
    "editor.formatOnSave": true
2. Restart VSC, open any file - it's instantaneously marked as edited.

Testing #18670 

Steps to Reproduce:

data.title: Color settings for selected text (single-click, double-click)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 7

Is there a way to prevent Visual Studio Code from highlighting editor text, specifically  when single clicking on it? The difference in highlight color between single clicking and double clicking (to fully select the text) is too subtle for me as I am color blind. I struggle with being able to tell if the word is actually selected for copy/paste operations (for example). A setting to change the colors associated with the click and double click would also be adequate

Thanks

data.title: Chrome debug process left lying around
data.body:
OS X
refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19110

1. Take the latest chrome debug vsix from [here](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19110#issue-202734053)
2. Install it in insiders and open vscode repository, choose launch vscode
3. Notice how the debugger can not attach - this is captured in a different bug
4. Stop the debug session, click on stop twice - this should kill the debug extension
5. Activity monitor - however the chrome extension is still running with 100% cpu as a code helper

Assigning to @weinand since he authored this [code](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/debug/electron-browser/rawDebugSession.ts#L493) and @roblourens  since his extension seems to go into a weird state

![screen shot 2017-01-24 at 15 31 28](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/22251178/32726cca-e24a-11e6-8e6a-443b54279769.png)

data.title: highlighted count in the status bar
data.body:
It would be nice to have the **highlighted count** (the number of occurrences of the word in the file) in the status bar, maybe on the left, like in Atom.

It's a different information than the number of **selected** occurrences of a word, and it's handy if you want to know the number of occurrences of a word in the file without having to launch a search or to select all occurrences.
